lead_paragraph: BANKING AND POLITICS.--A writer in The Clarleston Mercury addresses the Banks in that part of the world, with an earnest adjuration against dabbling in politics. He disclaims all reason to suspect then of any such meddlesome intentions; confesses they have always behaved themselves well, and managed the finances of the *State sublimely;
